sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 1, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Korrektur an Der freie Satz.
Von 11–¾1h Floriz.
Jause bei Sacher, dann Kärntnerstraße.
Nach dem Abendessen lesen wir die Korrektur.
Lie-Liechen schreibt nachts (näht, stopft usw.!).
Corrections to Free Composition.
From 11 o’clock to 12:45, Floriz.
Afternoon snack at the Sacher, then the Kärntnerstraße.
After supper we read the corrected text.
Lie-Liechen writes in the night (sews, darns, etc.!).

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 2, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Eva van Hoboken u. Erich Voß Neujahrswünsche.
Von Pollak (Br.): bittet um Verschiebung.
An Pollak (tel.): also Mittwoch den 10. I.
An Deutsch (tel.): Einiges über v. H. erfahren.
Nach der Jause Wege.
Nach dem Abendessen kurzes Diktat.
From Eva van Hoboken and Erich Voß: New Year’s greetings.
From Pollak (letter): asks for postponement.
To Pollak (by telephone): okay, Wednesday, January 10.
To Deutsch (by telephone): a few things learned about Hoboken.
After teatime, errands.
After supper, a short dictation.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 3, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Bamberger (Br.): Dank u. Erwiderung der Wünsche.
Korrektur an Der freie Satz.
An Frau Komorn (Billet): Erwiderung.
Geld an Saphir 30, Winterhilfe Winterhilfe: a charitable association in Austria during the First Republic. 5 u. 5 x 1 Schilling Wohlfahrt.
Nach der Jause Wege.
To Bamberger (letter): thanks and reply to the greetings.
Corrections to Free Composition.
To Mrs. Komorn (note): reply.
Money: to Saphir 30 shillings, for winter aid 5 shillings, and 5 x 1 shilling for welfare.
After teatime, errands.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 4, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Mit Kalmus tel. verabredet: Dienstag ½6h.
Nach der Jause Wege.
Date with Kalmus arranged by telephone: Tuesday at 5:30.
After teatime, errands.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 5, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Frl. Kahn (Karte): wird ab 1934 „ein Schloß vor dem Munde haben“!
Harte Arbeit an den Beispielen zur IV., II. u. VI. Stufe.
Floriz von 11–12h: ob er Sinigaglia spielen soll u. andere Fragen zum Vortrag der Programmstücke.
Bleiben zuhause.
Vor dem Abendessen Diktat.
From Miss Kahn (postcard): from 1934 on she "will have a lock on her mouth"!
Difficult work on the examples for the harmonic degrees IV, II, and VI.
Floriz from 11 to 12 o’clock: should he play Sinigaglia, and other questions concerning the performance of pieces on the program.
We stay at home.
Before supper, dictation.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 6, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Wir bleiben wieder zuhause!!

Von 5–7h Architekt Schmid: Possibly Heinrich Schmid (1885–1949), a pupil of Otto Wagner, who designed numerous buildings for the city of Vienna during the interwar period. ein Spaß à la Weißberger, Bloch – Stravinsky! Will v. H. zu einer wirtschaftlich gesunden Basis führen, ich soll das Mittel der Sanirung sein, Nachbar, Lehrer, Freund, Gesellschafter u. Geld ihm freimachen für die unwirtschaftlichen Ausgaben! Ein gewissenloser Raub stände bevor! Diesmal hat v. H. nicht vergessen, was ich vor mich hingemurmelt hatte; offenbar war die Frage bestellt u. er wartet auf Antwort (??).
We stay home again!!

From 5 to 7 o’clock, the architect Schmid: a joke à la Weißberger, Bloch – Stravinsky! He would like to lead Hoboken to a financially healthy basis; I am supposed to be the means of his rehabilitation: neighbor, teacher, friend, and partner, and to allow him to use his money for economically unsound expenditures! A certain theft is about to occur! This time Hoboken did not forget what I had muttered under my breath; evidently the question was asked and he is waiting for an answer (??).

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 7, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Um 11h Abschluß der Notenbeispiele u. damit des ganzen satztechnischen Teiles in Der freie Satz – bin furchtbar abgemartert!
Jause bei Sacher.

Um ¾9h Rozsas: findet mich gut, lobenswert, also vorwärts zum Heil
Glück meines theueren Lie-Liechens!
At 11 o’clock, completion of the music examples and thus of the entire compositionally technical part of Free Composition – I am utterly martyred!
Afternoon snack at the Sacher.

At 8:45, Rozsas: he finds me well, praiseworthy; and so forwards to salvation and the
happiness of my dear Lie-Liechen!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 8, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Oppel (K.): erste Meldung vom Abschluß des freien Satzes.
An Vrieslander (K.): das selbe.
An Dr. Salzer (Br.FS 40/1, [20]): Einladung für Sonntag.
Von v. Hoboken (rec. Br.OJ 89/7, [1]): das Honorar sei angewiesen, der Grund gekauft „hoffentlich . .“ – Einwände gegen Jonas.
Von Deutsch (Br.OJ 10/3, [205]): Pläne.
Wolf ist wieder angetreten, ist für meinen Plan den Generalbaß betreffend zu haben – legt Fragen von Cube vor!?!
To Oppel (postcard): first report on the completion of Free Composition.
To Vrieslander (postcard): the same.
To Dr. Salzer (letterFS 40/1, [20]): invitation for Sunday.
From Hoboken (registered letterOJ 89/7, [1]): the lesson fee has been paid in, the plot purchased, "I hope that …" – Objections towards Jonas.
From Deutsch (letterOJ 10/3, [205]): plans.
Wolf has again stepped into line, is agreed to my plan concerning figured bass – presents questions from Cube!?!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 9, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Um 7h morgens, ich träume: Furtwängler küßt mich weinend: „Ich werde Sie nicht mehr sehen . .“, – auch ich weine u. erwache.
Ein Fläschchen zur Analyse.
An Jonas (K.OJ 5/18, 34 ): der freie Satz abgeschlossen.
An Dr. Roszas S. 43.

Um 2h telefonirt an Architekt Schmid: Possibly Heinrich Schmid (1885–1949), a pupil of Otto Wagner, who designed numerous buildings for the city of Vienna during the interwar period. Mitteilung von v. H.s Brief, er will uns aufsuchen.

¾6–¼8h Kalmus – bedenklich unreif, ein Kalkulirer von Beruf, kein geistiger Vertreter eines großen Unternehmens. Sprechen über eine neue Propaganda, über die Behandlung der Notenbeispiele, zuletzt liest er einen Brief aus New York vor über eine gekürzte Ausgabe von Harmonielehre u. Kontrapunkt!
At 7 o’clock in the morning, I dream: Furtwängler kisses me, crying: "I shall not see you again …" – I, too, cry and awake.
A sample taken for analysis.
To Jonas (postcardOJ 5/18, 34 ): Free Composition completed.
To Dr. Roszas, 43 shillings.
At 2 o’clock, telephone call to architect Schmid: communication about Hoboken’s letter, he wants to meet with us.

5:45 to 7:30, Kalmus – alarmingly immature, a calculator by profession, not an intellectual representative of a great firm. We speak about a new form of publicity, about the treatment of the music examples; at the end he reads out a letter from New York about the abbreviated editions of Theory of Harmony and Counterpoint!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 10, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Saphir von 10–¾11h: erzählt von Hofrat Schmidt als unbedingten Verehrer, „nur Einer“ usw. – für das Klavier verlangt er S. 1500.

An Deutsch (K.): die Themen sind gut – über das Gespräch mit Schmid, Possibly Heinrich Schmid (1885–1949), a pupil of Otto Wagner, who designed numerous buildings for the city of Vienna during the interwar period. The conversation mentioned here is referred to in the diary entry for January 6. Brief von v. H., Besuch von Kalmus.
An Kalmus (K.): von Goos – Oppel ist abzusehen – welche Nummer hat der Tonwille?
An Kalmus (Br.): die Binde der „Eroica“ u. meine Antwort an Brockhaus u. Herder zur Findung eines Schlagwortes.
Von 5–¼8h Pollak u. Schwester: zeige das Manuscript, lese u. spiele vor.
Rf. Lamond: Schumanns Klavierkonzert, Schmidt: IV. Sinfonie.
Saphir from 10 to 10:45: speaks about Counselor Schmidt as an unconditional adulator, "there is only one," etc. – for the piano, he asks for 1,500 shillings.
To Deutsch (postcard): the topics are good – concerning the conversation with Schmid, Hoboken’s letter, Kalmus’s visit.
To Kalmus (postcard): pay no attention to Goos–Oppel – what is the catalog number for Der Tonwille?
To Kalmus (letter): the binding of the "Eroica," and my reply to Brockhaus and Herder as a way of coming up with a catchword.
From 5 o’clock to 7:15, Pollak and his sister: I show them the manuscript, read aloud and play.
Radio, Lamond: Schumann’s Piano Concerto, Schmidt’s Fourth Symphony.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 11, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Befund: 1.54% – so viel wie lange Zeit nicht! Von Salzer (Br.): werden Sonntag kommen!
In der Mercurbank legen wir S. 3000 ins Buch u. beheben Zinsen u. den Rest.
An Frühmann S. 56, Kultussteuer S. 20, Calwey S. 8.50.

Rf. aus Budapest schöne Sendung einer Zigeunerkapelle, eines Sängers u. einer Sängerin. According to the listings in Radio Wien, the gypsy choir Imre Magyari performed Hungarian folk music, with Isabella Nagy and Josef Cselényi as soloists.
Result: 1.54% – more than there has been for a long time! From Salzer (letter): they will come on Sunday!
At the Mercurbank: we deposit 3,000 shillings, and withdraw the interest and the remainder.
To Frühmann 56 shillings, religious tax 20 shillings, Calwey 8.50 shillings.
Radio: from Budapest, a beautiful broadcast of a gypsy choir, a solo male singer, and a female soloist.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 12, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Vrieslander (K.): Glückwunsch.
Von 5–¾8h Deutsch legt ein Schubert-Lied vor.
From Vrieslander (postcard): best wishes.
From 5 o’clock to 7:45, Deutsch presents a Schubert song.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 13, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An v. H. (Br.OJ 89/7, [2]): bestätige den Empfang des Geldes, gebe meiner Freude Ausdruck über den Ankauf des Grundstückes, rate noch einmal zu Wien – der Abschluß des freien Satzes steht bevor.
Von Oppel (Br.): Glückwunsch – Bericht aus dem Haus, hofft mich im Sommer zu sehen!?!
½7–½8h ein Bote von Deutsch mit Fragen!

To Hoboken (letterOJ 89/7, [2]): I confirm the receipt of the money, express my delight about the purchase of the plot of land, advise him once more in favor of Vienna – the completion of Free Composition is imminent.
From Oppel (letter): best wishes – family report, hopes to see me in the summer!?!
From 6:30 to 7:30, a messenger from Deutsch, with questions!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 14, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Landshoff (Br. durch PetersKA, [1]): Dank. Schenker is sending his formal thanks for Landshoff’s "Urtext" edition of Bach’s Two- and Three-Part Inventions (Leipzig: C. F. Peters, 1933), which he received in the mail a month earlier (see diary entry for December 15, 1933).

5–½8h Salzer u. Frau; er erzählt von Kabastas Begeisterung u. seiner Absicht mich zu besuchen. Wilfort u. Salzer bringen die Weisheiten von Freitag („. . was haben die Herren doch für ein kurzes Gedärm“ Schiller) brühwarm an u. erregen Aufsehen damit – sie leiten mein Ansehen (u. Geld) auf ihre Mühlen, mir bleibt die Rolle des Wauwau! Die Toscanini-Platte erweist die Unzulänglichkeit des Dirigenten, freilich – nur mir.
To Landshoff (letter, via PetersKA, [1]): thanks.

From 5 to 7:30, Salzer and his wife; he speaks about Kabasta’s enthusiasm, and his intention to visit me. Wilfort and Salzer freshly apply the wisdoms from Friday ("… what thin skin the gentleman have": Schiller), and thus cause a sensation – they guide my attention (and money) to their mills; I am left with the role of going "woof, woof"! The record by Toscanini reveals the inadequacy of the conductor, of course – only to me.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 15, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Deutsch (Br.OJ 10/3, [206]): versteht noch immer nicht stellt noch eine Frage, Schmidt Possibly Heinrich Schmid (1885–1949), a pupil of Otto Wagner, who designed numerous buildings for the city of Vienna during the interwar period. See the diary entries for January 6, 8, 9, and 13, which refer to Hoboken’s intention to purchase a plot of land in Vienna. zieht uns aus der Hoboken-Falle.
Von der Bank durch einen Boten S. 813.30 (engl.).
„Wolle“ von Der freie Satz weggeräumt, Takte in die Beispiele eingetragen.
An Deutsch (Br.WSLB-Hds 191.577): noch eine Erklärung.
Diktat eines Briefes an Peters wegen der Handschriften – sende ihn nicht ab!?!?! Lie-Liechen hatte auch schon die Urschrift gemacht!?!?!
From Deutsch (letterOJ 10/3, [206]): he still does not understand, asks another question; Schmidt is pulling us out of the Hoboken trap.
From the bank, via messenger, 813.30 shillings (English currency).
"Wool" removed from Free Composition, bar numbers entered in the music examples.
To Deutsch (letterWSLB-Hds 191.577): a further clarification.
Dictation of a letter to Peters regarding the manuscripts – I do not send it off!?!?! Lie-Liechen had already prepared the first draft!?!?!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 16, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Voß (Br.): dankt für die Mitteilung über den „Freien Satz“.
An Jonas (K.OJ 5/18, 35 ): Adresse von Landshoff?
An Mozio (Br.): Mahnung.
Lesen Korrekturen zur Stufe in Der freie Satz.
From Voß (letter): thanks for the communication about Free Composition.
To Jonas (postcardOJ 5/18, 35 ): Landshoff’s address?
To Mozio (letter): reminder.
We read the corrected text of "Scale Degree" in Free Composition.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 17, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von v. Hoboken (Br.OJ 89/7, [3]): gekauft heißt nicht gebaut; er kommt erst Ende März.
An v. Hoboken (Br.OJ 89/7, [4]): Geld für den „Freien Satz“ kommt erst 1935 in Frage.
Den Brief an Lie-Liechens Familie beendet u. zum Testament gelegt.
Wege.
Von Deutsch (Br.OJ 10/3, [207]): versteht noch immer nicht; bitte ihn telephonisch um nochmalige Zusendung des Notenblattes; ich berichte über v. H.s Brief.
Lie-Liechen schreibt bis spät nachts.
From Hoboken (letterOJ 89/7, [3]): "purchased" does not mean "built"; he is not coming until the end of March.
To Hoboken (letterOJ 89/7, [4]): money for Free Composition does not come into question until 1935.
The letter to Lie-Liechen’s family is finished, and placed beside the will.
Errands.
From Deutsch (letterOJ 10/3, [207]): he still does not understand; I ask him via telephone to send me the music manuscript once more, report on Hoboken’s letter.
Lie-Liechen writes until late at night.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 18, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Floriz von 11–¾12h – ladet mich aus, berichtet von einer Besserung seiner Lage; von Brünauers Aeußerung, die mich – nebst anderen Gründen nötigt, an Brünauer (Br.): Absage zu schreiben.
Brief an LandshoffKA, [1] über Peters geschickt.

Floriz from 11 o’clock to 11:45 – he invites me to go out with him, reports on an improvement in his situation; concerning Brünauer’s statement, which (among other reasons) necessitates my writing to Brünauer (letter): write me your resignation.
Letter to LandshoffKA, [1] sent via Peters.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 19, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: „Metrik“ in Der freie Satz erreicht.
Salzer behelligt mich mit Jonas’ Bitte, noch 15 Exemplare zu nehmen: „welcher Preis“? Mit „. . wir haben dankbar genossen“ quittirt er unsere Mühe am letzten Sonntag.
Wege.
"Meter" in Free Composition arrived at.
Salzer pesters me with Jonas’s request to take a further 15 copies: "at what price"? With the words "We gratefully enjoyed ourselves," he acknowledges the trouble we took the previous Sunday.
Errands.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 20, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Wir bleiben zuhause – die ersten Beispiele zur Metrik in Der freie Satz eingetragen. Nach der Jause Diktat: Stufe zuende.

Von Jonas (K.OJ 12/6, [28]): Landshoffs Adresse, war in Hamburg nur zu Besuch – das Buch Oswald Jonas, Das Wesen des musikalischen Kunstwerks: Einführung in die Lehre Heinrich Schenkers (Vienna: Saturn-Verlag, 1934). wird erscheinen.
Erstaufführung von „Giuditta“ (Rf.): ich höre nur den 1. Akt. According to the radio listings in the Neue freie Presse, Franz Lehár’s opera was broadcast from the Vienna State Opera.
We stay at home – the first examples for "Meter" in Free Composition entered. After teatime, dictation: "Scale Degree" finished.
From Jonas (postcardOJ 12/6, [28]): Landshoff’s address; he was in Hamburg only for a visit – the book will be published.
First performance of Giuditta (on the radio): I listen to only Act 1.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 21, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An der Metrik in Der freie Satz u. Korrespondenz.
Jause bei Sacher.
Nach dem Abendessen lesen wir Korrekturen, Lie-Liechen bis spät nachts beim Schreiben.
Work on "Meter" in Free Composition, and correspondence.
Afternoon snack at the Sacher.
After supper, we read the corrected text; Lie-Liechen is up late into the night writing.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 22, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Deutsch (K.): erbitte den Aufsatz zurück.
An Mozio (K.): zweite Mahnung.

Nach der Jause kaufen wir bei Walda Hauswäsche,
(S. 52).
Bleiben dem Konzert fern (Violin – Buxbaum).
To Deutsch (postcard): request the return of the article.
To Mozio (postcard): second reminder.

After teatime, we purchase household linens at Walda
(52 shillings).
We stay away from the concert (Violin – Buxbaum).

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 23, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Nach der Jause ein Stück Ringstraße, seit Langem zum ersten Mal!
Von Baronesse Fischer (Visitenk.): Dank für Peter Weiss.

Kolisch-Quartett im Rf. According to the radio listings in the Neue freie Presse, the program comprised Beethoven’s Op. 132 in A minor and Mozart’s K. 575 in D (erroneously given in the listings as being in the key of A major).
After teatime, a section of the Ringstraße, for the first time in a long time!
From Baroness Fischer (visiting card): thanks for Peter Weiss.
Kolisch Quartet on the radio.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 24, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Hastig gearbeitet.
Von Kalmus (Br.): Vorschlag eines Schlagwortes (schlecht! L.-L.).
Von 11–½12h Diktat.
Aergerliche Klavierstunde (Kahn!?).
Geld für Strom, Krankenkasse usw.
Diktat nach dem Abendessen – früh zu Bett.
Worked hastily.
From Kalmus (letter): suggestion for a catchword ("a bad choice!" L.-L.).
From 11 to 11:30, dictation.
Exasperating piano lesson (Kahn!?).
Money paid for electricity, health insurance, etc.
Dictation after supper – early to bed.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 25, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Schlechte Nacht!
An Kalmus (Br.): werde einen Gegenvorschlag machen – wo bleiben die Tantiemen?
An den Drei Masken Verlag (K.): Abrechnung für 1933?
A bad night!
To Kalmus (letter): I shall make a counter-suggestion – where are my royalties?
To Drei Masken Verlag (postcard): account for 1933?

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 26, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Nach der Jause Wege; Blumen.
Von Floriz (K.): wird Sonntag kommen.
Diktat.
After teatime, errands; flowers.
From Floriz (postcard): he will come on Sunday.
Dictation.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 27, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Floriz um 11h: berichtet von einer Besserung seiner Lage; Einblick in die Welt von „Beziehungen“.
Nach der Jause Wege.
Von Mozio (K.): wird in anfangs Februar eine Rate zahlen – schiebt die Schuld der Verzögerung auf seinen Anwalt.
Lie-Liechen schreibt bis spät nachts.
Floriz at 11 o’clock: reports an improvement in his condition; insight into the world of "connections."
After teatime, errands.
From Mozio (postcard): he will pay an installment at the beginning of February – he shifts the blame for the delay on to his lawyer.
Lie-Liechen writes until late at night.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 28, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Diktat nach Tisch.
Am Klavier: Haydn-Stücke.
Bei Sacher Jause.
Kärntnerstraße – Graben – 71er. A streetcar line in Vienna, which has existed since 1907, and runs between the Central Cemetery and the Stock Exchange.
Lie-Liechen schreibt bis 12h.
Dictation after lunch.
At the piano: pieces by Haydn.
At the Sacher for afternoon snack.
Kärntnerstraße – Graben – the no. 71.
Lie-Liechen writes until midnight.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 29, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Fanny Violin (K.): kommt morgen.
Fragebogen der Kultusgemeinde ausgefüllt, recomm. ab.
Korrektur – Lie-Liechen schreibt bis 12h.
From Fanny Violin (postcard): she will come tomorrow.
Questionnaire from the Jewish Religious Community filled out, sent by registered mail.
Work on the corrections – Lie-Liechen writes until midnight.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 30, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Zuhause geblieben.
Korrekturen, neue Arbeit.
Frl. Violin 5–8h.
We stay home.
Corrections, new work.
Miss Violin from 5 to 8 o’clock.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker January 31, 1934
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Bamberger (K.): kommt Freitag.
Korrektur zuende.
Nach der Jause Wege.
Abends lesen wir 14 Blätter, Lie-Liechen macht nachts alles fertig.
From Bamberger (postcard): he is coming on Friday.
Work on the corrections finished.
After teatime, errands.
In the evening we read fourteen pages, Lie-Liechen completes everything at night.
